item.title: Energy Improvement and Extension Act of 2008

latestAction.text: Rules Committee Resolution H. Res. 1516 Reported to House. Rule provides for consideration of H.R. 7201 and H.R. 7202. Measure will be considered read. Bill is closed to amendments. It shall be in order to consider in the House the bills H.R. 7201 and H.R. 7202. All points of order against consideration of the bills are waived except those arising under clause 10 of rule XXI. The bills shall be considered as read. All points of order against the bills are waived. The previous question shall be considered as ordered on the bills to final passage without intervening motion except: (1) one hour of debate equally divided and controlled by the chairman and ranking minority member of the Committee on Ways and Means; and (2) one motion to recommit, on
Referred to the Subcommittee on National Parks, Forests and Public Lands.

item.title: Waiving a requirement of clause 6(a) of Rule XIII with respect to consideration of certain resolutions reported from the Committee on Rules.

latestAction.text: Motion to reconsider laid on the table Agreed to without objection.

item.text: Pursuant to the provisions of H. Res. 1533, H. Res. 1516 is laid on the table.
WITHDRAWAL OF RESOLUTION - Pursuant to the rule, Mr. Arcuri withdrew the resolution from consideration. (consideration: CR H10316)
DEBATE - The House proceeded with one hour of debate on H. Res. 1516.
Considered as privileged matter. (consideration: CR H10309-10316; text of measure as introduced: CR H10310)
Placed on the House Calendar, Calendar No. 285.

It shall be in order to consider in the House the bills H.R. 7201 and H.R. 7202. All points of order against consideration of the bills are waived except those arising under clause 10 of rule XXI. The bills shall be considered as read. All points of order against the bills are waived. The previous question shall be considered as ordered on the bills to final passage without intervening motion except: (1) one hour of debate equally divided and controlled by the chairman and ranking minority member of the Committee on Ways and Means; and (2) one motion to recommit, on
The House Committee on Rules reported an original measure, H. Rept. 110-902, by Mr. Arcuri.
The House Committee on Rules reported an original measure, H. Rept. 110-902, by Mr. Arcuri.

summary.text: Sets forth the rule for consideration of the bill (H.R. 7201) to amend the Internal Revenue Code of 1986 to provide incentives for energy production and conservation, and for other purposes and providing for consideration of the bill (H.R. 7202) to amend the Internal Revenue Code of 1986 to extend certain expiring provisions, to provide individual income tax relief.

bill.title: Providing for consideration of the bill (H.R. 7201) to amend the Internal Revenue Code of 1986 to provide incentives for energy production and conservation, and for other purposes and providing for consideration of the bill (H.R. 7202) to amend the Internal Revenue Code of 1986 to extend certain expiring provisions, to provide individual income tax relief, and for other purposes.

dublinCore.dc:rights: Pursuant to Title 17 Section 105 of the United States Code, this file is not subject to copyright protection and is in the public domain.
dublinCore.dc:contributor: Congressional Research Service, Library of Congress
dublinCore.dc:description: This file contains bill summaries and statuses for federal legislation. A bill summary describes the most significant provisions of a piece of legislation and details the effects the legislative text may have on current law and federal programs. Bill summaries are authored by the Congressional Research Service (CRS) of the Library of Congress. As stated in Public Law 91-510 (2 USC 166 (d)(6)), one of the duties of CRS is "to prepare summaries and digests of bills and resolutions of a public general nature introduced in the Senate or House of Representatives". For more information, refer to the User Guide that accompanies this file.
